Problem:
import numpy as np

def compute_metrics(data):
    mean = np.mean(data)
    std_dev = np.std(data)
    data_normalized = (data - mean) / std_dev
    if np.any(data_normalized > 2):
        alert_flag = True
    else:
        alert_flag = False
    return mean, std_dev, alert_flag

# Example data
metrics = compute_metrics(np.array([10, 20, 30, 40, 50]))
print(metrics)",

If you modify the algorithm to subtract three times the standard deviation instead of the mean, will the alert flag still be affected by extreme data values?
Explanation: Altering the subtraction factor to three times the standard deviation still involves deriving values from the original data's deviation relative to its statistical properties. Extreme values will still ultimately affect the normalized outcome and thus the alert flag, though the flag might be set differently depending on the new threshold relation.
